comment: She's nice and does not expect too much from you. If class is online you will not meet for more than 1 hour. Daily assignments (for summer) and a final exam that you go over before. She can be really picky with major assignments and stuff. She says you can ask questions but she made me feel dumb when I did.

Professor Talley is very sweet! As an online class you will use Flipgrid a lot. We has zoom meetings, which were short and informational. She give you things to do sheets for each week and the work load is very manageable. As long as you do the work for her class you should get a good grade. She is reachable through email and responds quickly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I do not know why she has a bad rating. I took her 4 week summer class and it was one of the easiest I have taken at KSU. Super sweet lady. Clear instructions, simple assignments, easy grader. Not a heavy lecture. We were on zoom for 30 minutes out of the entire 2 hr and 45 min time slot.

Professor Talley was a great professor. I took her for a 4 week session online due to the virus and she made it so simple and easy to understand what we had to do. This was a really easy and fun class. You just have to make sure you attend her class because they do consist of a lot of info. Take her if you can! You won't regret it (:
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If I could give her a 0 rating I would. This is the rudest most unprofessional professor I've ever had at KSU. She has taught me what I DONT want to be as a teacher. The course content itself is easy but you only get one absence and going to class with her is torture. DO NOT TAKE HER.
DO NOT TAKE HER. SHE NEVER LIKES TO BE WRONG. WORST GRADER.
2 lesson plans, 1 med term and a PTA presentation. Also have to learn to play the recorder. Easy A
